text: The Creeslough explosion happened on 7 October 2022 at an Applegreen petrol station in Creeslough, a village in north County Donegal, Ireland. It killed ten people and left eight hospitalised. It is the highest number of civilian deaths in the county in decades. The cause is unknown, although accidental gas leak is seen as a possible cause. ==References== Category:October 2022 events Category:2020s in the Republic of Ireland Category:2022 disasters in Europe Category:Explosions in Europe Category:Explosions in 2022
title: Creeslough explosion
